issues.title: mirror-ddl and mirror-ddl and related script commands not working with Plone > 4.2.1
issues.body:
```

1. Install a checkout of ore.contentmirror 0.7.0svn with bulk.py patch for 
Plone 4.2.x in a Plone 4.2.5 or 4.3.1 development buildout
2. do proper database setup
3. try to run:

./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl mysql | sed '/content_id INTEGER NOT NULL,/ 
s//content_id INTEGER NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,/g' > ./mysql-schema.sql

Usually with Plone 4.2.1 a proper database schema is created.

Instead you get an error::

     Usage: ./bin/instance run /path/to/ddl.py [options] portal_path

     interpreter: error: no such option: -c

The same error message occurs with the mirror-bulk command.

### Installation details ###

Plone 4 development buildout created with paster

OS: MacOSX 10.8.4
custom Python 2.7.3
Plone Version 4.2.1 or 4.3.1 version.cfg setup
MySQL: Server version: 5.5.29 MySQL Community Server (GPL)

Remark:
-------

If you already had run these commands with Plone 4.2.1 you can run 
ore.contentmirror with the Plone Versions 4.2.5 and 4.3.1 after doing in place 
migration.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `develo...@acsr.de` on 18 Jul 2013 at 5:38

issues.title: In the SQL file generation the autoincrement of field "content_id" is missing!
issues.body:
```
Export schema of Plone for new database
===========================================

Symptom
--------------------------

With the default sql file generated by mirror-ddl command, adding a lot of real 
content in Plone does not increment the field "content_id" of all the tables 
generated using this file. So you end up with overwriting existing entries in 
the RDBMS instead of adding new ones.

Case
------------------

Due to a bug in the SQL file generation the autoincrement of field "content_id" 
is missing!

Currently we manage this by postprocessing the sql file with sed.

Procedures see below.

Solution ?
---------------------

No idea where to fix.


Procedures to reproduce and workaround
===========================================

Using the default ore.contentmirror configuration only for Plone
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-

* file ore.contentmirror/ore/contentmirror/content.zcml

```
# !python

```
<configure xmlns="http://namespaces.zope.org/zope"
           xmlns:ore="http://namespaces.objectrealms.net/mirror">
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.document.ATDocument" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.event.ATEvent" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.favorite.ATFavorite" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.file.ATFile" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.folder.ATFolder" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.folder.ATBTreeFolder" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.image.ATImage" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.link.ATLink" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.newsitem.ATNewsItem" />
</configure>
```

```

* At the instance root run command::


```
# !bash

```
./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl mysql > ./Plone-mysql-schema-temp.sql
```

```
#### IMPORTANT ####

* Use droptables option -d only when wiping out existing data!

```
# !bash

```
    ./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl -d mysql > ./Plone-mysql-schema-temp.sql
```

```

Modify SQL file manually
------------------------------

Due to a bug in the SQL file generation the autoincrement of field "content_id" 
is missing!

see 
http://fatalweb.com/question/contentmirror-integration-with-plone-4-5721836.html

#### Add "Autoincrement" flag ####

Add "Autoincrement" flag to every field "content_id" in every table.

* Change every

```
# !bash

```
    content_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
```

```

* to

```
# !bash

```
    content_id INTEGER NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
```

```

* sed one liner

```
# !bash

```
sed '/content_id INTEGER NOT NULL,/ s//content_id INTEGER NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,/g' ./Plone-mysql-schema-temp.sql > ./Plone-mysql-schema.sql
rm ./Plone-mysql-schema-temp.sql
```

```

Using the special configuration for iwe.projectmag
-------------------------------------------------------

```
# !python

```
<configure xmlns="http://namespaces.zope.org/zope"
           xmlns:ore="http://namespaces.objectrealms.net/mirror">
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.document.ATDocument" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.event.ATEvent" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.favorite.ATFavorite" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.file.ATFile" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.folder.ATFolder" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.folder.ATBTreeFolder" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.image.ATImage" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.link.ATLink" />
    <ore:mirror content="Products.ATContentTypes.content.newsitem.ATNewsItem" />
    <!-- begin contenttypes from my.package -->
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.projects.Projects" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.project.Project" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.magazine.Magazine" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.article.Article" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.message.Message" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.vote.Vote" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.shout.Shout" />
    <ore:mirror content="my.package.content.shouts.Shouts" />
    <!-- end contenttypes from my.package -->
</configure>
```

```

* At the instance root run command

```
# !bash

```
./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl mysql > ./my-mysql-schema-temp.sql
```

```

#### IMPORTANT ####

* Use droptables option -d only when wiping out existing data!

```
# !bash

```
./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl -d mysql > ./my-mysql-schema-temp.sql
```

```

* one liner with sed

```
# !bash

```
./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl mysql | sed '/content_id INTEGER NOT NULL,/ s//content_id INTEGER NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,/g' > ./my-mysql-schema.sql
```

```

```

issues.title: run mirror-bulk: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__of__'
issues.body:
```
### Steps to reproduce ###

run the mirror-bulk command

### Error ###

If your ZOPE instance has no 'admin' user, for whatever reason, running bulk.py 
you get an error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "./bin/mirror-bulk", line 262, in <module>
        ore.contentmirror.bulk.main()
      File "[...]/ore.contentmirror/ore/contentmirror/bulk.py", line 148, in main
        portal = get_portal(app, portal)
      File "[...]/ore.contentmirror/ore/contentmirror/bulk.py", line 126, in get_portal
        portal = setup_app(app, portal)
      File "[...]/ore.contentmirror/ore/contentmirror/bulk.py", line 119, in setup_app
        user = user.__of__(app.acl_users)
    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__of__'

line numbers vary, because I use the Plone 4.2 patch by Andrew Mlecko!

### Solutions ###

    * add an additional superuser named 'admin'

Or if not suitable:

    * In bulk.py change the superuser in the second line of the function 'def setup_app(app, portal):' from 'admin' to 'youradmin'

### related issue #26 ###

https://code.google.com/p/contentmirror/issues/detail?id=26

### System ###

ore.contentmirror = 0.7.1 # svn with patch 
https://code.google.com/p/contentmirror/issues/detail?id=82
MySQL  Ver 14.14 Distrib 5.5.29, for osx10.6 (i386) using readline 5.1
SQLAlchemy = 0.6.3
Plone = 4.2.1.1
MySQL-python = 1.2.4
Zope = 2.13.16
Python = 2.7.3
MacOSX = 10.8.2

issues.title: ore.contentmirror breaks with empty Plone  4.0.8
issues.body:

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Set up a new Plone site (4.0.8):
$ paster create -t plone4_buildout myproject
Run all the buildout steps, start the instance

ADD NO CONTENT!

Shut the instance down

2. Add ore.contentmirror into the mix

After verifying that the site runs, add ore.contentmirror to buildout.cfg as 
per instructions, add ore.contentmirror as a development egg into 
myproject/src, and re-run buildout

3. Set up the database

$ ./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl postgresql > schema.sql

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `mart...@jarn.com` on 27 Apr 2011 at 9:48

issues.title: generated schema incompatible with Pg 8.4
issues.body:
```
./bin/instance run ./bin/mirror-ddl postgresql > mirror.sql

yields code that cannot be run by modern PostgreSQL servers. Issues discovered 
so far are:

1. DATETIME -> TIMESTAMP
2. BLOB -> BYTEA
3. BOOLEAN must have values out of (True, False)

Used version: SVN trunk
```

```
Two issues:
   SA.Table object not being able to evaluate to boolean:
   SA/CM generating postgresql DDL was fubared

SA.Table:
  line 47 of peer.py
  self.transformer.table object can not be evaluated to a Boolean value.

The workaround I ended up doing was either:
  if self.tranformer.table is not None
  and then str(self.trasnformer.table) when it concatenates another value
(3 lines below 47)

(Pdb) !self.transformer.table
Table('atdocument', MetaData(None), Column('content_id', Integer(),
ForeignKey('content.content_id'), table=<atdocument>, primary_key=True,

    - Boolean, BLOB, DATETIME
    Manually I ended up changing ddl from BOOLEAN to smallint (then in
pgadmin created boolean)
    Then changing BLOB to bytea
    Changing DATETIME to timestamp

Using latest ubuntu py2.6, paster plone3_site defining 4a3 as version with
postgresql 8.4

I think testing around this tease out this issue quickly.  It does not
appear to be a CM issue.  But you are faster than me in identifying the
real culprit

Original comment by `kapilt@gmail.com` on 29 Jun 2008 at 7:38
- Changed state: **Fixed**

```
as applies to ordered containers, container position is actually a bit tricky to
implement, its one thing to serialize, but to keep the state synchronous isn't
currently possible in a uniform manner. ie. container movement operations don't
generate modification events for the container, so the system doesn't know when
positions are modified in a container. Even if they did, they would need to 
include
the objects whose positions where modified, for us to serialize the position 
state
with constant time costs. its only when the objects within the container are 
modified
post order modification that we can serialize their current position to the 
database.
so its not possible for us to mirror this information over with 100% accuracy 
outside
of a bulk operation. what this amounts to in a real world delta between the 
zodb vs.
relational states isn't clear, and while correction code could be added to 
minimize
deltas, there would always be the possibility of a delta between the database
position serialization and the zodb position state. the alternative is to
modify/monkey the code of the archetypes ordered container implementation to 
generate
the delta event content mirror needs to ensure
serialized positions in constant time.

for non ordered containers, the ordering is creation time order, which the bulk 
tool
respects, when loading in bulk, and this order would also work for the 
synchronous
operations, with natural primary key ordering.
```

Original comment by `runy...@gmail.com` on 26 Jun 2009 at 3:42

```
at the moment bulk import / sync doesn't work with container ordering.

the only way i see to make this work is via the new mirror.async package. else 
we're talking about modifying 
an arbitrary set of rows synchronous to the user request.

ie. a folder with a thousand items, move item in position two to the end. you 
have to update every 
intermediate row to reflect its new position. that's the underlying problem 
that needs a good solution for this 
to happen, the brute force approach is only viable via mirror.async

```

Original comment by `kapilt@gmail.com` on 27 Jun 2009 at 11:47

```
If the ordering index were a string, you would never have to update more than 
one
row, because given two non-equal strings it is always possible to construct a 
third
that lies between them. You would have to fetch the row just above and below 
the row
you are moving, get their indexes, and construct a third string that sorted 
between
them. So if the new row were going between:

  Folder  |  Welcome  |  "ghhi"
  Folder  |  About Us |  "gmz"

then you might make it:

  Folder  |  Contact  |  "gk"

In the very worst case — where a clever user kept, say, moving the last item 
up
between the first two in the list — the string would have to grow by 
something like
one or two bits (I'd have to write the actual algorithm to be sure) each time 
an item
was moved. But I think that is still a vast improvement over having to update 
more
than one row when the user has, well, updated a single row. :-)
```

Original comment by `brandon....@gmail.com` on 27 Jun 2009 at 12:49

```
Implementing a linked list type structure would make moves pretty cheap.  Also, 
if
transactions are supported, you don't have to issue an update statement on 
every row
to fix the ordering.
```

Original comment by `bry...@pdq.net` on 27 Jun 2009 at 4:01

```
A linked list would still make it necessary to UPDATE more than just the row 
that is
being updated; at least two rows, in the general case, would have to be 
updated. And,
two transactions making ordering changes at the same time could quite easily 
break
the list entirely, whereas my scheme is quite robust in the face of many changes
coming in at once. Finally, if you selected only a few items from the database 
using
a WHERE clause but wanted to put them in order for display, a linked list would 
fail
quite catastrophically: without the intermediate nodes, you would have no idea 
where
the handful of nodes you'd selected went in the larger list.  With my scheme,
however, any arbitrary subset of rows can always be properly ordered even in the
absence of any other information from the table.
```

Original comment by `brandon....@gmail.com` on 27 Jun 2009 at 4:11

```
brandon's solution looks like the right one to me. the major issue with the 
linked list implementation is that its 
not easy to query out order in a database independent way, where as brandon's 
solution using the character 
string column, allows for users to easily apply an order by column clause. 
thanks brandon.

it looks like we still have to fetch the whole set on a container ordering 
change in order to determine relative 
position, ie. move item in position 10 to position 3, but at least the update 
scenario is manageable.


```

So i'm using alan's implementation as starting point with some changes. Namely 
don't 
wake contained objects from the zodb. When serializing a content only serialize 
it by 
itself, not the entire parent container order. When an object position is 
moved, the 
plone tool monkeypatch fires an event that generates a separate reposition 
operation 
that reserializes all the contained content positions for a container. It does 
so 
using objectIds to avoid waking contained children.

Original comment by `stefan.e...@gmail.com` on 3 Jul 2008 at 7:58

```
fixed in trunk (r49). nutshell of the error message, is that the object copied 
event
sends the object in the event without having established a containment context 
for
it, hence the failure of reference catalog lookup. z2 introduces a new event, 
object
cloned event that does have the copied object with containment. however the
subscriber in the copy case is actually unneeded, as the copy also creates an 
object
added event which will kick off serialization. so removing the zcml subscriber
registration and the subscriber fixes the issue. also checked move event, but 
the
object has containment context.
```

heirarchy via
specification of join depth on the mapper for good performance in producing 
hierarchy
displays. To avoid any unesc field fetches and polymorphic resolution for a 
site map

should
get documented. database level tree support has some variance, and dependence 
on db
PL for triggers has portablity issues.

could you elaborate on the use cases for this ? if you want all documents under 
a
container, can't you just use the secondary site node class mapper with a join 
depth
sufficiently deep to cover querying the subtree?

i think any approach which incorporates modified preorder traversal will have 
to wait
for an async mirror implementation, the tree modification costs have

or solr integration for fts.

Original comment by `kapilt@gmail.com` on 13 Sep 2008 at 11:19

```
The use case I have is finding all content beneath a particular container, so in
addition to content inside of the container in question, I need content that is 
at
any point in the containment heirarchy from that point down to any possible 
depth.
This is used for listing recent content added in the containment heirarchy such 
as
rss feeds or other recent content displays. As a result, the search would also 
need
to be sorted on creation_date and filtered on particular portal types.

Join depth could get difficult or inefficient with depths of over 5 or 6 and 
could
get really bad at depths of over 20 as the generated sql could get quite large 
and
potentially require parameter adjustment on some db engines defaults to support
really enormous sql.

Adding an attribute to the content that is the relative path (e.g. 
/path/to/content)
allows for a constant time attribute that would allow for the use case I'm 
dealing with.

I think that one of the benefits of using a relational database is the ability 
to
perform searches using all of the features of standard sql.  If we want to move 
all
search functionality to an outside search engine, then it might not be worth
exporting to a database, but rather a direct filesystem dump.
```

Original comment by `kapilt@gmail.com` on 5 Apr 2010 at 5:56

```
digging into this a bit further, i think i've got a workaround. The behavior is 
fairly bizarre (very plonish), the portal folder class init sets the 
description, 
which gets routed through the atfield descriptor, which invokes the description 
field 
set,  which in turn is inherited from a field field, and tries to treat the 
value 
like its a file, and wants to inspect its mimetype. What's not clear is how 
these 
would ever work in the real world sans contentmirror, as the object won't have 
an 
acquisition context when its created. I'm going to investigate that a little 
more.

an alternative workaround is not to use AT field properties, for example 
commenting 
out the description field property in the example iq.cmtest package, means 
everything 
loads normally. For contentmirror i'm probably going to have to attach a fake 
mimetypes registry to the class when loading it.
```

Original comment by `kapilt@gmail.com` on 9 Apr 2010 at 8:10

```
wow.. digging through this was painful. wicked is evil, it monkey patches all 
the 
field/sets ands gets and pushed them through a bunch of event subscriber 
chains, so 
you have field.set, making field.get calls, which in turn calls field.set with 
initializer keyword args, again all through a series of event subscribers. at 
first i 
thought it was the wicked monkey patches making this work. but in truth, its 
the plone 
site as a zope component site manager, which getToolByName will lookup values 
in 
first, and which the site has registered as a local utility. i'm going to 
switch 
content mirror to push/pop site managers around the load to fix this.
```

davydany was able to give me access to his instance so i could look at this 
error.

The problem was that the buildout was configured to load/mirror the content 
class, before loading the contentmirror configuration. Changing the zcml load 
order, such that the contentmirror configuration was loaded first fixed the 
issue. Clearly the error message for such a case needs to be better constructed 
so that the underlying issue is more obvious.

Original comment by `p.j.m.st...@gmail.com` on 20 Sep 2010 at 5:57

```
> I think the problem might be in SQLAlchemy or in contentmirror itself.

The only change contentmirror could make would be to guess at the encoding. 
This will sometimes fail. It's much better to be explicit about the encoding. 

> Unfortunately I am using the default functionality of Plone 4

In that case, you should try posting your issue to the Plone Users mailing 
list. Plone is supposed to be using unicode internally, so you need to find out 
how non-unicode content is making its way into Plone.

```

Original comment by `jean.jor...@gmail.com` on 21 Sep 2010 at 5:28

```
I just wanted to echo jean's comment that afaics this issue is about 
misconfiguration of plone. Contentmirror does handle unicode and does have 
several tests to that effect with russian and simplified chinese characters. 
The only safe/sane place to interpret encoding and normalize the byte strings 
to unicode is the application tier that accepts and displays inputs, ie. plone. 
 The storage layer can't safely make such guesses. 

http://plone.org/support/forums/i18n
```

Original comment by `backup.r...@gmail.com` on 24 Jun 2013 at 6:35

```
# Workaround #
--------------

There is a difference how the zopepy interpreter is setup by the 
plone.recipe.zope2instanc recipe.

With Plone 4.2.1 you get the version pinned to:

plone.recipe.zope2instance = 4.2.3

With Plone 4.3.1 you get 4.2.11

If you pin down 

plone.recipe.zope2instance = 4.2.3

the ore.contentmirror commands are working again.

Side effect of this pindown are not evaluated currently. Feedback welcome.
```
